page.title: 06THE PONTFADOG OAK.
page.content: The oak tree is on Cilcochwyn farm land,which is in Pontfadog.The tree is hollow in the middle due to its very old age.It is said to be the oldest oak tree in the British Isles,older than a thousand years.It is a Sessile oak and in 1966 it was in the Guinness Book of Records as having the largest girth of an oak tree at 42 feet and 9 inches.Some time ago a section fell off so it is no longer in the book of British records. In 1984 a tree preservation order was placed on it,as in the opinion of Clwyd County Council, and the local people it is worth looking after.
